/en/actions/creating-actions/sharing-act.title: Sharing actions and workflows with your organization
/en/actions/creating-actions/sharing-act.intro: You can share an action or reusable workflow with your organization without publishing the action or workflow publicly.

/en/actions/creating-actions/releasing-a.title: Releasing and maintaining actions
/en/actions/creating-actions/releasing-a.intro: You can leverage automation and open source best practices to release and maintain actions.

/en/actions/creating-actions/developing-.title: Developing a third party CLI action
/en/actions/creating-actions/developing-.intro: Learn how to develop an action to set up a CLI on GitHub Actions runners.

/en/actions/guides.title: Guides for GitHub Actions
/en/actions/guides.intro: These guides for GitHub Actions include specific use cases and examples to help you configure workflows.

/en/copilot.title: GitHub Copilot documentation
/en/copilot.intro: You can use GitHub Copilot to get autocomplete-style suggestions from an AI pair programmer as you code.

/en/copilot/quickstart.title: Quickstart for GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/quickstart.intro: GitHub Copilot can help you work, by offering inline suggestions as you code.

/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot.title: Overview of GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot, including use cases and terms that govern GitHub Copilot data.

/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot/a.title: About GitHub Copilot Individual
/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot/a.intro: GitHub Copilot can help you code by offering autocomplete-style suggestions. You can learn how GitHub Copilot works, and what to consider while using GitHub Copilot.

/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot/a.title: About GitHub Copilot Business
/en/copilot/overview-of-github-copilot/a.intro: With GitHub Copilot Business you can manage access to GitHub Copilot for your organization.

/en/copilot/using-github-copilot.title: Using GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/using-github-copilot.intro: Use GitHub Copilot to increase your productivity.

/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting.title: Getting started with GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting.intro: You can start using GitHub Copilot by installing the extension in your preferred environment.

/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/finding.title: Finding public code that matches GitHub Copilot suggestions
/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/finding.intro: If you allow GitHub Copilot to make suggestions that match publicly available code, you can see references to the matching code on GitHub.com.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business.title: Managing Copilot Business
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business.intro: Learn how to manage your Copilot Business subscription.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/re.title: Reviewing your organization's audit logs for Copilot Business
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/re.intro: Review the audit logs for your Copilot Business subscription to understand what actions have been taken and by which users.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/ma.title: Managing access for Copilot Business in your organization
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/ma.intro: Learn how to manage access to GitHub Copilot Business in your organization, and review usage data to inform your decisions.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/ma.title: Managing policies for Copilot Business in your organization
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/ma.intro: Learn how to manage policies for GitHub Copilot Business in your organization.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/en.title: Enabling and setting up GitHub Copilot Business
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/en.intro: To use GitHub Copilot Business, you need to set up a subscription for your organization.

/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/co.title: Configuring content exclusions for GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/managing-copilot-business/co.intro: You can prevent specified files from being used to inform code completion suggestions made by GitHub Copilot. GitHub Copilot will not be available in excluded files.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise.title: GitHub Copilot Enterprise
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot Enterprise and the features available with it.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/ov.title: Overview
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/ov.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot Enterprise, and how to participate in the beta.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/ov.title: About GitHub Copilot Enterprise
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/ov.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot Enterprise and the features available with it.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.title: Enabling GitHub Copilot Enterprise
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.intro: Learn how to enable the features available with the GitHub Copilot Enterprise beta.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: Copilot Chat in GitHub.com
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: You can chat with Copilot Chat in GitHub.com to learn out about aspects of software development, or to understand or improve specific lines of code.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: About GitHub Copilot Chat
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: GitHub Copilot Chat can help you by providing answers to coding related questions directly within GitHub.com or a supported IDE.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.title: Using GitHub Copilot Chat in GitHub.com
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.intro: You can use Copilot Chat to answer general questions about software development, or specific questions about the code in a repository.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: Copilot pull request summaries
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: With Copilot pull request summaries, you can create an AI-generated description for a pull request.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: About Copilot pull request summaries
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: With Copilot pull request summaries, you can create an AI-generated description for a pull request.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.title: Creating a pull request summary with GitHub Copilot
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.intro: You can generate a summary in the description of a pull request, or as a comment.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: Copilot docset management
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: With Copilot docset management, you can create private docsets from repositories in your organization. Members of your organization can then set your organization's private docsets as the context for Copilot Chat in GitHub.com.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.title: About Copilot docset management
/en/copilot/github-copilot-enterprise/co.intro: Copilot docset management can help you by providing a chat-based interface between you and specific docsets. You can ask questions within the scope of a given docset, and receive answers in synthesized summaries.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.title: Creating private docsets
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/copilot/gith.intro: You can generate a private docset from a repository in your organization and then set it as the context for Copilot Chat in GitHub.com.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat.title: GitHub Copilot Chat
/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot Chat, including use cases, best practices, and limitations.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat/about-gi.title: About GitHub Copilot Chat
/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat/about-gi.intro: GitHub Copilot Chat can help you by providing answers to coding related questions  directly within a supported IDE.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat/using-gi.title: Using GitHub Copilot Chat in your IDE
/en/copilot/github-copilot-chat/using-gi.intro: You can start using GitHub Copilot Chat by installing the extension in your preferred environment.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli.title: GitHub Copilot in the CLI
/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli.intro: Learn about GitHub Copilot in the CLI, including use cases, best practices, and limitations.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/ab.title: About GitHub Copilot in the CLI
/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/ab.intro: GitHub Copilot in the CLI can help you by providing either command suggestions or explanations of given commands.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/en.title: Enabling GitHub Copilot in the CLI
/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/en.intro: You can enable or disable GitHub Copilot in the CLI for your organization.

/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/us.title: Using GitHub Copilot in the CLI
/en/copilot/github-copilot-in-the-cli/us.intro: You can use gh, the GitHub command line interface, to work with GitHub Copilot in the CLI.

/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot.title: Configuring GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot.intro: You can manage the configuration of GitHub Copilot in a supported IDE, in your organization, or on GitHub.com.

/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.title: Configuring GitHub Copilot settings on GitHub.com
/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.intro: You can change your personal settings on GitHub.com to configure GitHub Copilot's behavior. This affects how GitHub Copilot functions in any supported IDE you use.

/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.title: Configuring GitHub Copilot in your environment
/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.intro: You can enable, configure, or disable GitHub Copilot in a supported IDE.

/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.title: Configuring network settings for GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/configuring-github-copilot/c.intro: You can connect to Copilot through an HTTP proxy and use custom certificates.

/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.title: Troubleshooting GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.intro: These guides provide information for troubleshooting GitHub Copilot.

/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.title: Troubleshooting common issues with GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.intro: This guide describes the most common issues with GitHub Copilot and how to resolve them.

/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.title: Viewing logs for GitHub Copilot in your environment
/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.intro: View logs to troubleshoot GitHub Copilot-related errors in your IDE.

/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.title: Troubleshooting firewall settings for GitHub Copilot
Troubleshooting network errors for GitHub Copilot
/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.intro: Resolve common errors related to proxies and custom certificates.

/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.title: Troubleshooting issues with GitHub Copilot Chat
/en/copilot/troubleshooting-github-copil.intro: Troubleshooting help for common issues with GitHub Copilot Chat.

/en/codespaces.title: Codespaces documentation
/en/codespaces.intro: Create a codespace to start developing in a secure, configurable, and dedicated development environment that works how and where you want it to.

/en/codespaces/overview.title: GitHub Codespaces overview
/en/codespaces/overview.intro: This guide introduces GitHub Codespaces and provides details on how it works and how to use it.

/en/codespaces/getting-started.title: Getting started with GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/getting-started.intro: Learn how to get started with GitHub Codespaces, then find out more about how a codespace works.

/en/codespaces/getting-started/quickstar.title: Quickstart for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/getting-started/quickstar.intro: Try out GitHub Codespaces in 5 minutes.

/en/codespaces/getting-started/understan.title: Understanding the codespace lifecycle
/en/codespaces/getting-started/understan.intro: You can develop in a GitHub Codespaces environment and maintain your data throughout the entire codespace lifecycle.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Developing in a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: Create a codespace to get started with developing your project inside a dedicated cloud environment. You can use your codespace in the browser or in a choice of code editors.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Developing in a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can work in a codespace using your browser, Visual Studio Code, a JetBrains IDE, or in a command shell.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Creating a codespace for a repository
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can create a codespace for a branch in a repository to develop online.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Creating a codespace from a template
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: If you're starting a new project, you can create a codespace from a blank template or choose a template specially designed for the type of work you want to do.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Deleting a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can delete a codespace you no longer need.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Opening an existing codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can reopen a codespace that you have closed or stopped and return to your work.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Working collaboratively in a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can work collaboratively with other people in a codespace by using Visual Studio Live Share.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Using source control in your codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: After making changes to a file in your codespace you can quickly commit the changes and push your update to the remote repository.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Using GitHub Codespaces for pull requests
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can use GitHub Codespaces in your web browser, or in Visual Studio Code to create pull requests, review pull requests, and address review comments.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Stopping and starting a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can stop and start your codespace to save resources and to pause work.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Forwarding ports in your codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can forward ports in your codespace to test and debug your application. You can also manage the port protocol and share the port within your organization or publicly.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Rebuilding the container in a codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can rebuild the dev container of a codespace you are working in to apply configuration changes. From time to time, you may want to perform a full rebuild.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Default environment variables for your codespace
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: GitHub sets default environment variables for each codespace.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Persisting environment variables and temporary files
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can configure custom environment variables so that they are set to the same value every time you open a codespace. You can also ensure that temporary files are not deleted when a codespace stops.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Connecting to a private network
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can connect GitHub Codespaces to resources on a private network, including package registries, license servers, and on-premises databases.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Getting started with GitHub Codespaces for machine learning
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: Learn about working on machine learning projects with GitHub Codespaces and its out-of-the-box tools.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Using GitHub Codespaces in Visual Studio Code
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can develop in your codespace directly in Visual Studio Code by connecting the GitHub Codespaces extension with your account on GitHub.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Using GitHub Codespaces in your JetBrains IDE
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can use the JetBrains Gateway to connect to your codespace and work in your favorite JetBrains IDE.

/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.title: Using GitHub Codespaces with GitHub CLI
/en/codespaces/developing-in-a-codespace.intro: You can work with GitHub Codespaces directly from your command line by using gh, the GitHub command line interface.

/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.title: Customizing your codespace
/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.intro: You can customize a codespace you've created to suit your own preferences.

/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.title: Renaming a codespace
/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.intro: You can change the codespace display name to one of your choice through GitHub.com or the GitHub CLI.

/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.title: Changing the shell in a codespace
/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.intro: You can change your shell in a codespace to keep the setup you're used to.

/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.title: Changing the machine type for your codespace
/en/codespaces/customizing-your-codespac.intro: You can change the type of machine that's running your codespace, so that you're using resources appropriate for the work you're doing.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Setting your user preferences
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can adjust your personal settings for GitHub Codespaces so that the codespaces you create always give you the development experience that works best for you.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Personalizing GitHub Codespaces for your account
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can personalize GitHub Codespaces by using a dotfiles repository on GitHub or by using Settings Sync.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Setting your default editor for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can set your default editor for Codespaces in your personal settings page.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Setting your default region for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can set your default region in the GitHub Codespaces profile settings page to personalize where your data is held.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Setting your timeout period for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can set your default timeout for GitHub Codespaces in your personal settings page.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Configuring automatic deletion of your codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: Inactive codespaces are automatically deleted. You can choose how long your stopped codespaces are retained, up to a maximum of 30 days.

/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.title: Choosing the stable or beta host image
/en/codespaces/setting-your-user-prefere.intro: You can choose to build codespaces using either the stable or beta version of the host image for the underlying virtual machine.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up your project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can configure GitHub Codespaces for the specific requirements of your project. Every time you create a codespace from your repository your working environment will have everything you need.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Adding a dev container configuration to your repository
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can add a custom dev container configuration to your repository to set up the GitHub Codespaces development environment for your codebase.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Introduction to dev containers
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: When you work in a codespace, the environment you are working in is created using a development container, or dev container, hosted on a virtual machine.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a Node.js project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: Get started with a Node.js, JavaScript, or TypeScript project in GitHub Codespaces by creating a custom dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a C# (.NET) project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: Get started with a C# (.NET) project in GitHub Codespaces by creating a custom dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a Java project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: Get started with a Java project in GitHub Codespaces by creating a custom dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a PHP project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: Get started with a PHP project in GitHub Codespaces by creating a custom dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a Python project for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: Get started with a Python project in GitHub Codespaces by creating a custom dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Configuring dev containers
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can customize the dev container configuration for your repository.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting a minimum specification for codespace machines
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can avoid under-resourced machine types being used for GitHub Codespaces for your repository.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Adding features to a devcontainer.json file
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: With features, you can quickly add tools, runtimes, or libraries to your dev container configuration.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Automatically opening files in the codespaces for a repository
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can set particular files to be opened automatically whenever someone creates a codespace for your repository and opens the codespace in the Visual Studio Code web client.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Specifying recommended secrets for a repository
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can add a setting to your dev container configuration that will prompt people to set specific development environment secrets when they create a codespace.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up your repository for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can set up your repository to make it easy for people to work on a project using GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Facilitating quick creation and resumption of codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can add a link to take people straight to a page for creating a codespace, with your choice of options preconfigured. Alternatively you can link to the "Resume codespace" page.

/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.title: Setting up a template repository for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/setting-up-your-project-f.intro: You can help people get started with a project by setting up a template repository for use with GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: Prebuilding your codespaces
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: To speed up codespace creation, you can configure your project to prebuild codespaces for specific branches in specific regions.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: About GitHub Codespaces prebuilds
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: GitHub Codespaces prebuilds help to speed up the creation of new codespaces for large or complex repositories.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: Configuring prebuilds
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: You can configure your project to prebuild a codespace automatically each time you push a change to your repository.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: Allowing a prebuild to access other repositories
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: You can permit your prebuild to access other GitHub repositories so that it can be built successfully.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: Managing prebuilds
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: You can review, modify, and delete the prebuild configurations for your repository.

/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.title: Testing dev container configuration changes on a prebuild-enabled branch
/en/codespaces/prebuilding-your-codespac.intro: When you change the dev container configuration for a branch that's enabled for prebuilds, you should test your changes in a codespace.

/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces.title: Managing your codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces.intro: You can use GitHub Codespaces settings to manage information that your codespace might need.

/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.title: Managing your account-specific secrets for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.intro: You can store sensitive information, like tokens, that you want to access in your codespaces via environment variables.

/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.title: Managing access to other repositories within your codespace
/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.intro: You can manage the repositories that GitHub Codespaces can access.

/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.title: Reviewing your security logs for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.intro: You can use the security log to review all actions related to GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.title: Managing GPG verification for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-your-codespaces/.intro: You can allow GitHub to automatically use GPG to sign commits you make in your codespaces, so other people can be confident that the changes come from a trusted source.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Managing GitHub Codespaces for your organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can manage and review how users in your organization can use  GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Enabling or disabling GitHub Codespaces for your organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can control which users can use GitHub Codespaces in your organization's private repositories.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Choosing who owns and pays for codespaces in your organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can choose whether codespaces are paid for and owned by your organization or by your members.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Listing the codespaces in your organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can list all of the currently active or stopped codespaces for your organization.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Managing the cost of GitHub Codespaces in your organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can check your GitHub Codespaces usage and set usage limits.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Managing development environment secrets for your repository or organization
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: Development environment secrets allow you to store sensitive information in your organization or repository for use with GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Reviewing your organization's audit logs for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can use the audit log to review all actions related to GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting access to machine types
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can set constraints on the types of machines users can choose when they create codespaces in your organization.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting the number of organization-billed codespaces a user can create
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can specify the maximum number of codespaces that any member of your organization, or collaborator, can create for the repositories in your organization.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting the base image for codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can specify which base images can be used to create the dev container for new codespaces created within your organization.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting the visibility of forwarded ports

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting the idle timeout period
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can set a maximum timeout period for any codespaces owned by your organization.

/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.title: Restricting the retention period for codespaces
/en/codespaces/managing-codespaces-for-y.intro: You can set a maximum retention period for any codespaces owned by your organization.

/en/codespaces/reference/allowing-your-c.title: Allowing your codespace to access a private registry

/en/codespaces/reference/using-github-co.title: Using GitHub Copilot in GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/reference/using-github-co.intro: You can use GitHub Copilot in GitHub Codespaces by adding a VS Code extension.

/en/codespaces/reference/using-the-vs-co.intro: You can use the Command Palette feature of Visual Studio Code to access many commands in GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/reference/security-in-git.title: Security in GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/reference/security-in-git.intro: Overview of the GitHub Codespaces security architecture, with guidelines to help you maintain security and minimize the risk of attack.

/en/codespaces/reference/disaster-recove.title: Disaster recovery for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/reference/disaster-recove.intro: This article describes guidance for a disaster recovery scenario, when a whole region experiences an outage due to major natural disaster or widespread service interruption.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Getting the most out of your included usage
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: Find out about the free use of GitHub Codespaces that's included with personal accounts.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/exporting.title: Exporting changes to a branch
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/exporting.intro: This article provides steps for exporting your codespace changes to a branch.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting creation and deletion of codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: This article provides troubleshooting steps for common issues you may experience when creating or deleting a codespace, including storage and configuration issues.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting authentication to a repository
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: Learn how to troubleshoot common authentication issues when you clone, push to, or pull from a repository in a codespace.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting your connection to GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: Troubleshooting help for connecting to GitHub Codespaces.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting prebuilds
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: You can use prebuilds to speed up the creation of codespaces. This article provides troubleshooting steps for common issues with prebuilds.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting personalization options for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: Troubleshooting steps for common issues with dotfiles and Settings Sync.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting port forwarding for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: Troubleshooting steps for common port forwarding issues.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.title: Troubleshooting GPG verification for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/troublesh.intro: This article provides troubleshooting advice for errors related to signing your commits in codespaces.

/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/working-w.title: Working with support for GitHub Codespaces
/en/codespaces/troubleshooting/working-w.intro: Tips on getting the best help from support for GitHub Codespaces.
