/en/graphql.title: GitHub GraphQL API documentation
/en/graphql.intro: To create integrations, retrieve data, and automate your workflows, use the GitHub GraphQL API. The GitHub GraphQL API offers more precise and flexible queries than the GitHub REST API.

/en/graphql/overview.title: Overview
/en/graphql/overview.intro: Learn about the GitHub GraphQL API, previews for upcoming changes, breaking changes, and limitations. You can also use the GraphQL Explorer to interact with the API on real GitHub data.

/en/graphql/overview/about-the-graphql-a.title: About the GraphQL API
/en/graphql/overview/about-the-graphql-a.intro: The GitHub GraphQL API offers flexibility and the ability to define precisely the data you want to fetch.

/en/graphql/overview/public-schema.title: Public schema
/en/graphql/overview/public-schema.intro: Download the public schema for the GitHub GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/overview/schema-previews.title: Schema previews
/en/graphql/overview/schema-previews.intro: You can preview upcoming features and changes to the GitHub GraphQL schema before they are added to the GitHub GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/overview/breaking-changes.title: Breaking changes
/en/graphql/overview/breaking-changes.intro: Learn about recent and upcoming breaking changes to the GitHub GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/overview/changelog.title: Changelog
/en/graphql/overview/changelog.intro: The GraphQL schema changelog is a list of recent and upcoming changes to our GraphQL API schema. It includes backwards-compatible changes, schema previews, and upcoming breaking changes.

/en/graphql/overview/rate-limits-and-nod.title: Rate limits and node limits for the GraphQL API
/en/graphql/overview/rate-limits-and-nod.intro: The GitHub GraphQL API has limitations in place to protect against excessive or abusive calls to GitHub's servers.

/en/graphql/reference.title: Reference
/en/graphql/reference.intro: View reference documentation to learn about the data types available in the GitHub GraphQL API schema.

/en/graphql/reference/queries.title: Queries
/en/graphql/reference/queries.intro: The query type defines GraphQL operations that retrieve data from the server.

/en/graphql/reference/mutations.title: Mutations
/en/graphql/reference/mutations.intro: The mutation type defines GraphQL operations that change data on the server.

/en/graphql/reference/objects.title: Objects
/en/graphql/reference/objects.intro: Objects in GraphQL represent the resources you can access.

/en/graphql/reference/interfaces.title: Interfaces
/en/graphql/reference/interfaces.intro: Interfaces serve as parent objects from which other objects can inherit.

/en/graphql/reference/enums.title: Enums
/en/graphql/reference/enums.intro: Enums represent possible sets of values for a field.

/en/graphql/reference/unions.title: Unions
/en/graphql/reference/unions.intro: A union  is a type of object representing many objects.

/en/graphql/reference/input-objects.title: Input objects
/en/graphql/reference/input-objects.intro: Input objects can be described as "composable objects" because they include a set of input fields that define the object.

/en/graphql/reference/scalars.title: Scalars
/en/graphql/reference/scalars.intro: Scalars are primitive values Int, Float, String, Boolean, or ID.

/en/graphql/guides.title: Guides
/en/graphql/guides.intro: Learn about getting started with GraphQL, migrating from REST to GraphQL, and how to use the GitHub GraphQL API for a variety of tasks.

/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graph.title: Introduction to GraphQL
/en/graphql/guides/introduction-to-graph.intro: Learn useful terminology and concepts for using the GitHub GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/guides/forming-calls-with-gr.title: Forming calls with GraphQL
/en/graphql/guides/forming-calls-with-gr.intro: Learn how to authenticate to the GraphQL API, then learn how to create and run queries and mutations.

/en/graphql/guides/using-global-node-ids.title: Using global node IDs
/en/graphql/guides/using-global-node-ids.intro: You can get global node IDs of objects via the REST API and use them in GraphQL operations.

/en/graphql/guides/migrating-from-rest-t.title: Migrating from REST to GraphQL
/en/graphql/guides/migrating-from-rest-t.intro: Learn best practices and considerations for migrating from GitHub's REST API to GitHub's GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/guides/using-the-explorer.title: Using the Explorer
/en/graphql/guides/using-the-explorer.intro: You can run queries on real GitHub data using the GraphQL Explorer, an integrated development environment in your browser that includes docs, syntax highlighting, and validation errors.

/en/graphql/guides/using-pagination-in-t.title: Using pagination in the GraphQL API
/en/graphql/guides/using-pagination-in-t.intro: Learn how to traverse data sets using cursor based pagination with the GraphQL API.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/graphql/guid.title: Managing enterprise accounts
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/graphql/guid.intro: You can manage your enterprise account and the organizations it owns with the GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/guides/using-the-graphql-api.title: Using the GraphQL API for Discussions
/en/graphql/guides/using-the-graphql-api.intro: Learn how to use the GitHub Discussions GraphQL API.

/en/graphql/guides/migrating-graphql-glo.title: Migrating GraphQL global node IDs
/en/graphql/guides/migrating-graphql-glo.intro: Learn about the two global node ID formats and how to migrate from the legacy format to the new format.

/en/github-cli.title: GitHub CLI documentation
/en/github-cli.intro: GitHub CLI is an open source tool for using GitHub from your computer's command line. When you're working from the command line, you can use the GitHub CLI to save time and avoid switching context.

/en/github-cli/github-cli.title: GitHub CLI
/en/github-cli/github-cli.intro: GitHub CLI is an open source tool for using GitHub from your computer's command line. When you're working from the command line, you can use the GitHub CLI to save time and avoid switching context.

/en/github-cli/github-cli/about-github-c.title: About GitHub CLI
/en/github-cli/github-cli/about-github-c.intro: GitHub CLI is a command-line tool that brings pull requests, issues, GitHub Actions, and other GitHub features to your terminal, so you can do all your work in one place.

/en/github-cli/github-cli/quickstart.title: GitHub CLI quickstart
/en/github-cli/github-cli/quickstart.intro: Start using GitHub CLI to work with GitHub in the command line.

/en/github-cli/github-cli/creating-githu.title: Creating GitHub CLI extensions
/en/github-cli/github-cli/creating-githu.intro: Learn how to share new GitHub CLI commands with other users by creating custom extensions for GitHub CLI.

/en/github-cli/github-cli/using-github-c.title: Using GitHub CLI extensions
/en/github-cli/github-cli/using-github-c.intro: Learn how to use custom extensions written by other GitHub CLI users.

/en/github-cli/github-cli/github-cli-ref.title: GitHub CLI reference
/en/github-cli/github-cli/github-cli-ref.intro: You can view all of the GitHub CLI commands in your terminal. The same information is available in the GitHub CLI manual.

/en/discussions.title: GitHub Discussions documentation
/en/discussions.intro: GitHub Discussions is a collaborative communication forum for the community around an open source or internal project. Community members can ask and answer questions, share updates, have open-ended conversations, and follow along on decisions affecting the community's way of working.

/en/discussions/quickstart.title: Quickstart for GitHub Discussions
/en/discussions/quickstart.intro: Enable GitHub Discussions on an existing repository or organization and start conversations with your community.

/en/discussions/guides.title: Discussions guides
/en/discussions/guides.intro: Discover pathways to get started or learn best practices for participating or monitoring your community's discussions.

/en/discussions/guides/best-practices-fo.title: Best practices for community conversations on GitHub
/en/discussions/guides/best-practices-fo.intro: You can use discussions to brainstorm with your team, and eventually move the conversation to an issue when you are ready to scope out the work.

/en/discussions/guides/finding-your-disc.title: Finding your discussions
/en/discussions/guides/finding-your-disc.intro: You can easily access every discussion you've created or participated in.

/en/discussions/guides/granting-higher-p.title: Granting higher permissions to top contributors
/en/discussions/guides/granting-higher-p.intro: Repository administrators can promote any community member to a moderator and maintainer.

/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.title: Collaborating with your community using discussions
/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.intro: Gather and discuss your project with community members and other maintainers.

/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.title: About discussions
/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.intro: Use discussions to ask and answer questions, share information, make announcements, and conduct or participate in a conversation about a project on GitHub.

/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.title: Participating in a discussion
/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.intro: You can converse with the community and maintainers in a forum within the repository for a project on GitHub.

/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.title: Collaborating with maintainers using discussions
/en/discussions/collaborating-with-your-.intro: You can contribute to the goals, plans, health, and community for a project on GitHub by communicating with the maintainers of the project in a discussion.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Managing discussions for your community
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can enable and configure GitHub Discussions for your repository, and you can use tools on GitHub to moderate conversations among community members.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Managing discussions
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can categorize, spotlight, transfer, or delete the discussions.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Managing categories for discussions
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can categorize discussions to organize conversations for your community members, and you can choose a format for each category.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Moderating discussions
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can promote healthy collaboration by marking comments as answers, locking or unlocking discussions, converting issues to discussions, and editing or deleting comments, discussions, and categories that don't align with your community's code of conduct.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Viewing insights for your discussions
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: Discussions insights provide data about your discussions' activity, views, and contributors.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Creating discussion category forms
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can customize the templates that are available for community members to use when they open new discussions in your repository.

/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.title: Syntax for discussion category forms
/en/discussions/managing-discussions-for.intro: You can use YAML syntax to define the fields in your discussion category forms.

/en/sponsors.title: GitHub Sponsors documentation
/en/sponsors.intro: Invest in the open source projects you depend on, support digital infrastructure, and make open source careers possible by sponsoring open source contributors and their projects. Build a GitHub Sponsors profile and receive compensation for your open source work.

/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.title: Getting started with GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.intro: Learn about GitHub Sponsors and how you can get involved as a sponsor or open source contributor.

/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.title: About GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.intro: GitHub Sponsors allows the developer community to financially support the people and organizations who design, build, and maintain the open source projects they depend on, directly on GitHub.

/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.title: Quickstart for finding contributors to sponsor
/en/sponsors/getting-started-with-github.intro: Learn some best practices for finding open source contributors to sponsor.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Sponsoring open source contributors
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can sponsor contributors, receive updates on developers and organizations you sponsor, and display a sponsor badge throughout GitHub.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: About sponsorships, fees, and taxes
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: Learn about sponsorships, payment, and tax information for GitHub Sponsors.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Sponsoring an open source contributor through GitHub
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can make payments through GitHub to a developer or organization who designs, creates, or maintains open source projects you depend on.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Sponsoring an open source contributor through Patreon
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can make payments through Patreon on GitHub.com to a developer or organization who designs, creates, or maintains open source projects you depend on.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Managing your sponsorship
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can manage who can see your sponsorship and whether you receive email updates from the sponsored account.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Attributing sponsorships to your organization
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can attribute the sponsorships paid by one of your organizations to another organization.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Paying for GitHub Sponsors by invoice
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: Organizations can set up invoicing to sponsor accounts.

/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.title: Unlinking your Patreon account from your GitHub account
/en/sponsors/sponsoring-open-source-cont.intro: You can disconnect your Patreon account from your GitHub account to stop receiving recognition for Patreon sponsorships on GitHub.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Receiving sponsorships through GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You or your organization can become a sponsored open source contributor to receive payments for your work, update your sponsorship details, and view and contact your sponsors.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: About GitHub Sponsors for open source contributors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: If you provide value to an open source project, you can become a sponsored contributor to receive payments for your work.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Setting up GitHub Sponsors for your personal account
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can become a sponsored developer by joining GitHub Sponsors, completing your sponsored developer profile, creating sponsorship tiers, submitting your bank and tax information, and enabling two-factor authentication for your account on GitHub.com.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Setting up GitHub Sponsors for your organization
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: Your organization can join GitHub Sponsors to receive payments for your work.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Enabling sponsorships through Patreon
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can connect your Patreon and GitHub accounts to receive GitHub Sponsors sponsorships through Patreon.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Using a fiscal host to receive GitHub Sponsors payouts
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can become a sponsored developer by joining GitHub Sponsors and choosing a fiscal host for your payouts to come through.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Editing your profile details for GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can update the information that potential sponsors see about your work.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Managing your sponsorship goal
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can set a goal for your sponsored developer or sponsored organization account to help the community understand the impact of sponsoring you.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Managing your sponsorship tiers
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can add a new sponsorship tier, or edit or retire an existing tier.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Viewing your sponsors and sponsorships
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can view and export detailed information and analytics about your sponsors and sponsorships.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Managing your payouts from GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can view information about past and future payouts from GitHub Sponsors and edit your bank information.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Contacting your sponsors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can send an email to your sponsors who have opted in to receive updates about your work.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Tax information for GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: Sponsored developers and organizations must submit tax information to GitHub and are responsible for evaluating and paying their own taxes.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Unlinking your Patreon account from your GitHub Sponsors profile
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: You can disconnect your Patreon account from your GitHub Sponsors profile to stop receiving new sponsorships through Patreon.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Disabling your GitHub Sponsors account
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: If you no longer want to participate in GitHub Sponsors, you can disable your GitHub Sponsors account.

/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.title: Unpublishing your GitHub Sponsors profile
/en/sponsors/receiving-sponsorships-thro.intro: If you don't have any sponsors, you can unpublish your GitHub Sponsors profile.

/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.title: Integrating with GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.intro: As an open source contributor, you can build custom tools to manage your GitHub sponsorships.

/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.title: Configuring webhooks for events in your sponsored account
/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.intro: You can configure webhooks to alert you when you receive new sponsorships or existing sponsors make changes to their sponsorships.

/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.title: Getting started with the Sponsors GraphQL API
/en/sponsors/integrating-with-github-spo.intro: Using the GraphQL API, you can build custom integrations to manage or review your sponsorships.

/en/sponsors/guides.title: Guides for GitHub Sponsors
/en/sponsors/guides.intro: Learn how to make the most of GitHub Sponsors.

/en/communities.title: Building communities documentation
/en/communities.intro: Learn best practices for moderating and setting up collaborative, safe, and effective communities using GitHub’s community-tested tools.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Setting up your project for healthy contributions
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: Repository maintainers can set contributing guidelines to help collaborators make meaningful, useful contributions to a project.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: About community management and moderation
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: GitHub offers tools that help repository maintainers establish and enforce standards of behavior in their communities on GitHub.com.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: About community profiles for public repositories
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: Repository maintainers can review their public repository's community profile to learn how they can help grow their community and support contributors. Contributors can view a public repository's community profile to see if they want to contribute to the project.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Accessing a project's community profile
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: View a public repository's community profile to check on a project's health and decide if you want to contribute.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Adding a code of conduct to your project
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: Adopt a code of conduct to define community standards, signal a welcoming and inclusive project, and outline procedures for handling abuse.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Setting guidelines for repository contributors
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: You can create guidelines to communicate how people should contribute to your project.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Adding a license to a repository
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: You can include an open source license in your repository to make it easier for other people to contribute.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Adding support resources to your project
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: You can create a SUPPORT file to let people know about ways to get help with your project.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Creating a default community health file
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: You can create default community health files, such as CONTRIBUTING and CODE_OF_CONDUCT. Default files will be used for any repository owned by the account that does not contain its own file of that type.

/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.title: Encouraging helpful contributions to your project with labels
/en/communities/setting-up-your-project-.intro: Apply the good first issue label to issues in your repository to highlight opportunities for people to contribute to your project.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Using templates to encourage useful issues and pull requests
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: Repository maintainers can add templates in a repository to help contributors create high-quality issues and pull requests.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: About issue and pull request templates
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: With issue and pull request templates, you can customize and standardize the information you'd like contributors to include when they open issues and pull requests in your repository.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Configuring issue templates for your repository
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: You can customize the templates that are available for contributors to use when they open new issues in your repository.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Syntax for issue forms
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: You can define different input types, validations, default assignees, and default labels for your issue forms.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Syntax for GitHub's form schema
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: You can use GitHub's form schema to configure forms for supported features.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Creating a pull request template for your repository
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: When you add a pull request template to your repository, project contributors will automatically see the template's contents in the pull request body.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Manually creating a single issue template for your repository
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: When you add a manually-created issue template to your repository, project contributors will automatically see the template's contents in the issue body.

/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.title: Common validation errors when creating issue forms
/en/communities/using-templates-to-encou.intro: You may see some of these common validation errors when creating, saving, or viewing issue forms.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Moderating comments and conversations
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: Moderating conversations creates a welcoming community for all contributors to your project by promoting healthy collaboration and de-escalating conflict. You can apply your community's code of conduct to discussions by viewing reported content, editing and deleting comments, and locking conversations.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Managing disruptive comments
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can hide, edit, or delete comments on issues, pull requests, and commits.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Locking conversations
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: Repository owners and collaborators, and people with write access to a repository, can lock conversations on issues, pull requests, and commits permanently or temporarily to defuse a heated interaction.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Limiting interactions in your repository
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can temporarily enforce a period of limited activity for certain users on a public repository.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Limiting interactions for your personal account
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can temporarily enforce a period of limited activity for certain users in all public repositories owned by your personal account.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Limiting interactions in your organization
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can temporarily enforce a period of limited activity for certain users in all public repositories owned by your organization.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Tracking changes in a comment
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can view the edit history of a comment or delete sensitive information from the edit history of a comment.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Managing how contributors report abuse in your organization's repository
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: You can allow contributors to report disruptive behavior directly to repository maintainers.

/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.title: Managing reported content in your organization's repository
/en/communities/moderating-comments-and-.intro: After a contributor reports disruptive content in a repository, repository maintainers can view and manage the report.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Maintaining your safety on GitHub
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: To build a positive and safe environment for yourself and the community for your project on GitHub, you can block and unblock users and report disruptive content.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Blocking a user from your personal account
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: You can block a user to deny them access to your activity and repositories, and to prevent them from sending you notifications.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Viewing users you've blocked from your personal account
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: You can view a list of all users you've blocked from your personal account.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Unblocking a user from your personal account
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: If you've mended fences with a GitHub user you've blocked, you can unblock their account.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Blocking a user from your organization
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: Organization owners and moderators can block anyone who is not a member of the organization from collaborating on the organization's repositories.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Viewing users who are blocked from your organization
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: You can view a list of all users whom you or other owners have blocked from your organization. If a user was blocked for a specific amount of time, you can see the amount of time they were blocked for.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Unblocking a user from your organization
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: Organization owners and moderators can unblock a user who was previously blocked, restoring their access to the organization's repositories.

/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.title: Reporting abuse or spam
/en/communities/maintaining-your-safety-.intro: You can report behavior and content that violates community guidelines and terms.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Documenting your project with wikis
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can use a wiki to share detailed, long-form information about your project.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: About wikis
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can host documentation for your repository in a wiki, so that others can use and contribute to your project.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Adding or editing wiki pages
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can add and edit wiki pages directly on GitHub or locally using the command line.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Creating a footer or sidebar for your wiki
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can add a custom sidebar or footer to your wiki to provide readers with more contextual information.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Editing wiki content
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can add images and links to content in your wiki, and use some supported MediaWiki formats.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Viewing a wiki's history of changes
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: Because wikis are Git repositories, every change you make is a commit that you can view.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Changing access permissions for wikis
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: Only repository collaborators can edit a public repository's wiki by default, but you can allow anyone with an account on GitHub.com to edit your wiki.

/en/communities/documenting-your-project.title: Disabling wikis
/en/communities/documenting-your-project.intro: You can disable your repository's wiki.

/en/pages.title: GitHub Pages documentation
/en/pages.intro: Learn how to create a website directly from a repository on GitHub.com. Explore website building tools like Jekyll and troubleshoot issues with your GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/quickstart.title: Quickstart for GitHub Pages
/en/pages/quickstart.intro: You can use GitHub Pages to showcase some open source projects, host a blog, or even share your résumé. This guide will help get you started on creating your next website.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Getting started with GitHub Pages
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can set up a basic GitHub Pages site for yourself, your organization, or your project.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: About GitHub Pages
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can use GitHub Pages to host a website about yourself, your organization, or your project directly from a repository on GitHub.com.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Creating a GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can create a GitHub Pages site in a new or existing repository.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Using custom workflows with GitHub Pages
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can take advantage of using GitHub Actions and GitHub Pages by creating a workflow file or choosing from the predefined workflows.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Configuring a publishing source for your GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can configure your GitHub Pages site to publish when changes are pushed to a specific branch, or you can write a GitHub Actions workflow to publish your site.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Deleting a GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can delete a GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Unpublishing a GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can unpublish your GitHub Pages site so that your current deployment is removed and the site is no longer available. This is different from deleting the site.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/pages/gettin.title: Changing the visibility of your GitHub Pages site
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/pages/gettin.intro: You can manage access control for your project site by publishing the site publicly or privately.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Creating a custom 404 page for your GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can display a custom 404 error page when people try to access nonexistent pages on your site.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Securing your GitHub Pages site with HTTPS
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: HTTPS adds a layer of encryption that prevents others from snooping on or tampering with traffic to your site. You can enforce HTTPS for your GitHub Pages site to transparently redirect all HTTP requests to HTTPS.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Using submodules with GitHub Pages
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: You can use submodules with GitHub Pages to include other projects in your site's code.

/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.title: Troubleshooting 404 errors for GitHub Pages sites
/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pa.intro: This guide will help you troubleshoot common reasons you may be seeing a 404 error.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Setting up a GitHub Pages site with Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can use Jekyll, a popular static site generator, to further customize your GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: About GitHub Pages and Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: Jekyll is a static site generator with built-in support for GitHub Pages.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Creating a GitHub Pages site with Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can use Jekyll to create a GitHub Pages site in a new or existing repository.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Testing your GitHub Pages site locally with Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can build your GitHub Pages site locally to preview and test changes to your site.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Adding content to your GitHub Pages site using Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can add a new page or post to your Jekyll site on GitHub Pages.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Setting a Markdown processor for your GitHub Pages site using Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can choose a Markdown processor to determine how Markdown is rendered on your GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Adding a theme to your GitHub Pages site using Jekyll
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can personalize your Jekyll site by adding and customizing a theme.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: About Jekyll build errors for GitHub Pages sites
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: If Jekyll encounters an error building your GitHub Pages site locally or on GitHub, you'll receive an error message with more information.

/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.title: Troubleshooting Jekyll build errors for GitHub Pages sites
/en/pages/setting-up-a-github-pages-site.intro: You can use Jekyll build error messages to troubleshoot problems with your GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.title: Configuring a custom domain for your GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.intro: You can customize the domain name of your GitHub Pages site.

/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.title: About custom domains and GitHub Pages
/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.intro: GitHub Pages supports using custom domains, or changing the root of your site's URL from the default, like octocat.github.io, to any domain you own.

/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.title: Managing a custom domain for your GitHub Pages site
/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.intro: You can set up or update certain DNS records and your repository settings to point the default domain for your GitHub Pages site to a custom domain.

/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.title: Verifying your custom domain for GitHub Pages
/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.intro: You can increase the security of your custom domain and avoid takeover attacks by verifying your domain.

/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.title: Troubleshooting custom domains and GitHub Pages
/en/pages/configuring-a-custom-domain-fo.intro: You can check for common errors to resolve issues with custom domains or HTTPS for your GitHub Pages site.

/en/education.title: GitHub Education documentation
/en/education.intro: GitHub Education helps you teach or learn software development with the tools and support of GitHub's platform and community.

/en/education/quickstart.title: Quickstart for GitHub Educators
/en/education/quickstart.intro: In about 15 minutes, teachers can get started with discounts, training, and tools for GitHub, then create a classroom for the students in a software development course using GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Explore the benefits of teaching and learning with GitHub Education
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Learn how GitHub Education can benefit your classroom, schoolwork, or research and how to apply for free access to various developer tools from GitHub's partners.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: GitHub Global Campus for students
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: As a student, use GitHub to collaborate on your school projects and build real-world experience.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: About GitHub Global Campus for students
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: GitHub Education offers students real-world experience with free access to various developer tools from GitHub's partners.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Apply to GitHub Global Campus as a student
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: As a student, you can apply to join GitHub Global Campus and receive access to the student resources and benefits offered by GitHub Education

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Why wasn't my application to Global Campus for students approved?
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Review common reasons that applications for GitHub Global Campus are not approved and learn tips for reapplying successfully.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: About GitHub Community Exchange
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Learn the skills you need to contribute to open source projects and grow your own portfolio, with GitHub Community Exchange.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: GitHub Global Campus for teachers
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: As a teacher, use GitHub to collaborate on your work in a classroom, student or research group, and more.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: About GitHub Global Campus for teachers
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: GitHub Global Campus offers teachers a central place to access tools and resources for working more effectively inside and outside of the classroom.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Apply to GitHub Global Campus as a teacher
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: If you're a teacher, you can apply to join GitHub Global Campus and receive access to the resources and benefits of GitHub Education.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Why wasn't my application to Global Campus for teachers approved?
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Review common reasons that applications for GitHub Global Campus are not approved and learn tips for reapplying successfully.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Use GitHub at your educational institution
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Maximize the benefits of using GitHub at your institution for your students, instructors, and IT staff with GitHub Education and our various training programs for students and instructors.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: About GitHub Campus Program
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: GitHub Campus Program offers GitHub Enterprise Cloud and GitHub Enterprise Server free-of-charge for schools that want to make the most of GitHub for their community.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: About GitHub Campus Experts
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: Enrich your college’s technical community by becoming a GitHub Campus Expert.

/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.title: Applying to be a GitHub Campus Expert
/en/education/explore-the-benefits-of-te.intro: As a student, you can apply to be a GitHub Campus Expert to gain new skills and grow your college’s technical community.

/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.title: Contribute with GitHub Community Exchange
/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.intro: With GitHub Community Exchange, you can use GitHub to contribute to open source and build your portfolio.

/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.title: Getting started with GitHub Community Exchange
/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.intro: Learn how to access GitHub Community Exchange and submit your repository.

/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.title: Submitting your repository to GitHub Community Exchange
/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.intro: You can submit your repository to GitHub Community Exchange for others to view or contribute to.

/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.title: Managing your submissions to GitHub Community Exchange
/en/education/contribute-with-github-com.intro: You can manage the purpose, topics, and offers assigned to each of your repositories in the GitHub Community Exchange gallery, or delete your repository submissions.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Manage coursework with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: With GitHub Classroom, you can use GitHub to administer or participate in a course about software development.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Get started with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: Learn how to configure and use GitHub Classroom to administer your course.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: About GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: Teachers and school administrators can use GitHub Classroom to create virtual classrooms, make and edit assignments, automatically grade assignment submissions, and more.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Glossary
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can review explanations of terminology for GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Teach with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: Learn how to set up your classroom and assignments.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Manage classrooms
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can create and manage a classroom for each course that you teach using GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: About assignments
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can use individual or group assignments in GitHub Classroom to teach students and grade their work.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Use the Git and GitHub starter assignment
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can use the Git & GitHub starter assignment to give students an overview of Git and GitHub fundamentals.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Create an individual assignment
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can create an assignment for students in your course to complete individually.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Create a group assignment
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can create a collaborative assignment for teams of students who participate in your course.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Editing an assignment
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can edit existing assignments in your course.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Extending an assignment's deadline for an individual or group
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can grant individual students and groups extensions to allow them more time to submit an assignment.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Monitor students' progress with the assignment overview page
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can use the assignment overview page to track the progress of each student or team on an assignment.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Reuse an assignment
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can reuse existing assignments in more than one classroom, including classrooms in a different organization.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Create an assignment from a template repository
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can create an assignment from a template repository to provide starter code, documentation, and other resources to your students.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Leave feedback with pull requests
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can leave feedback for your students in a special pull request within the repository for each assignment.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Use autograding
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can automatically provide feedback on code submissions from your students by configuring tests to run in the assignment repository.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Using GitHub Classroom with GitHub CLI
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can use gh, the GitHub command line interface, to work with GitHub Classroom directly from your command line.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Register a learning management system with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can configure an LTI-compliant learning management system (LMS) with GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Connect a learning management system course to a classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can configure an LTI-compliant learning management system (LMS) course to connect to GitHub Classroom so that you can import a roster for your classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Integrate GitHub Classroom with an IDE
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can help your students write, test, and debug code by preconfiguring a development environment for assignment repositories on GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Integrate GitHub Classroom with an IDE
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can preconfigure a supported integrated development environment (IDE) for assignments you create in GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Using GitHub Codespaces with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can use GitHub Codespaces as the preferred editor in your assignments to give students access to a browser-based Visual Studio Code environment with one-click setup.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: About using Visual Studio Code with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can configure Visual Studio Code as the preferred editor for assignments in GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: About using MakeCode Arcade with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can configure MakeCode Arcade as the online IDE for assignments in GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Repl.it with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: As of July 13 2021, Repl.it integration is no longer available in GitHub Classroom.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Run student code in an IDE
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can run the code from a student assignment within the integrated development environment (IDE) that you configured for the assignment.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Learn with GitHub Classroom
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can participate in coursework in GitHub Classroom and see results from your teacher.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: View autograding results
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can see results from autograding within the repository for your assignment.

/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.title: Viewing your assignment's deadline
/en/education/manage-coursework-with-git.intro: You can view the deadline for an assignment at any time through the README of your assignment repository.

/en/education/explore-internship-project.title: Explore internship projects with GitHub Octernships
/en/education/explore-internship-project.intro: You can apply to paid professional experiences through your GitHub account and GitHub Global Campus.

/en/education/explore-internship-project.title: About GitHub Octernships
/en/education/explore-internship-project.intro: You can apply to paid professional experiences through your GitHub account and GitHub Global Campus.

/en/education/explore-internship-project.title: Applying for GitHub Octernships
/en/education/explore-internship-project.intro: Learn how to apply to paid professional experiences with GitHub Octernships.

/en/education/guides.title: Guides for GitHub Education
/en/education/guides.intro: These guides for GitHub Education help you teach and learn both GitHub and software development.

/en/desktop.title: GitHub Desktop documentation
/en/desktop.intro: With GitHub Desktop, you can interact with GitHub using a GUI instead of the command line or a web browser. You can use GitHub Desktop to complete most Git commands from your desktop, such as pushing to, pulling from, and cloning remote repositories, attributing commits, and creating pull requests, with visual confirmation of changes.

/en/desktop/overview.title: Overview
/en/desktop/overview.intro: Learn about GitHub Desktop and quickly create your first repository.

/en/desktop/overview/about-github-deskto.title: About GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/overview/about-github-deskto.intro: GitHub Desktop helps you work with projects hosted on GitHub.

/en/desktop/overview/getting-started-wit.title: Getting started with GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/overview/getting-started-wit.intro: Learn how to set up, authenticate, and configure GitHub Desktop to allow you to contribute to projects directly from your machine.

/en/desktop/overview/creating-your-first.title: Creating your first repository using GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/overview/creating-your-first.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to create and manage a Git repository without using the command line.

/en/desktop/overview/supported-operating.title: Supported operating systems for GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/overview/supported-operating.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop on any supported operating system.

/en/desktop/overview/github-desktop-keyb.title: GitHub Desktop keyboard shortcuts
/en/desktop/overview/github-desktop-keyb.intro: You can use keyboard shortcuts in GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/overview/launching-github-de.title: Launching GitHub Desktop from the command line
/en/desktop/overview/launching-github-de.intro: You can launch GitHub Desktop from the command line.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Installing and authenticating to GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: Install GitHub Desktop and connect your GitHub or GitHub Enterprise accounts.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Setting up GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: You can set up GitHub Desktop to suit your needs and contribute to projects.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Installing GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: You can install GitHub Desktop on supported Windows or macOS operating systems.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Authenticating to GitHub in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: You can securely access your account's resources on GitHub Desktop by authenticating to GitHub.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: About connections to GitHub in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: GitHub Desktop uses HTTPS to securely exchange data with GitHub.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Updating GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: GitHub Desktop automatically downloads updates and installs them when you restart. You can also manually check for updates.

/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.title: Uninstalling GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/installing-and-authenticatin.intro: You can uninstall GitHub Desktop from your computer at any time.

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: Configuring and customizing GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: Set up Git, connect your default editor, and customize settings to align GitHub Desktop with your workflow.

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: Configuring Git for GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: You can manage Git configuration settings for your local repositories with GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: Configuring basic settings in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: You can access settings for protecting your privacy, connecting accounts to GitHub Desktop, and configuring Git.

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: Configuring a default editor in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: You can configure GitHub Desktop to open files in your project with your preferred text editor or integrated development environment (IDE).

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: Setting a theme for GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: You can set a theme to customize the look and feel of GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.title: About Git Large File Storage and GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/configuring-and-customizing-.intro: GitHub Desktop includes Git Large File Storage for managing large files.

/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.title: Adding and cloning repositories
/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.intro: Add existing repositories from your local computer to GitHub Desktop, or clone repositories from GitHub.

/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.title: Adding a repository from your local computer to GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.intro: You can add any Git repository to GitHub Desktop, even if it's not a GitHub repository.

/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.title: Adding an existing project to GitHub using GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.intro: You can add an existing Git repository to GitHub using GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.title: Cloning and forking repositories from GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to clone and fork repositories that exist on GitHub.

/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.title: Cloning a repository from GitHub to GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/adding-and-cloning-repositor.intro: You can use GitHub to clone remote repositories to GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch.title: Making changes in a branch
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch.intro: Use your favorite text editor, such as Visual Studio Code, to make changes to your project, then use GitHub Desktop to visualize useful commits.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/m.title: Managing branches in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/m.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to create a new branch off of an existing branch in your repository so you can safely experiment with changes.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/c.title: Committing and reviewing changes to your project in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/c.intro: GitHub Desktop tracks all changes to all files as you edit them. You can decide how to group the changes to create meaningful commits.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/s.title: Stashing changes in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/s.intro: You can temporarily save your changes without committing them to a branch by stashing the changes in GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/v.title: Viewing the branch history in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/v.intro: You can see details about any commit in GitHub Desktop, including a diff of the changes the commit introduced.

/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/p.title: Pushing changes to GitHub from GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/making-changes-in-a-branch/p.intro: As you commit changes to your project locally, you can push those changes to GitHub from GitHub Desktop so that others may access them from the remote repository.

/en/desktop/managing-commits.title: Managing commits
/en/desktop/managing-commits.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to amend, cherry-pick, reorder, revert, and squash commits.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/options-for.title: Options for managing commits in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/options-for.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to maintain an easy-to-follow commit history.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/undoing-a-c.title: Undoing a commit in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/undoing-a-c.intro: You can undo a commit before you have pushed it to the remote branch.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/amending-a-.title: Amending a commit in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/amending-a-.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to amend your last commit.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/reverting-a.title: Reverting a commit in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/reverting-a.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to revert a specific commit to remove its changes from your branch.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/cherry-pick.title: Cherry-picking a commit in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/cherry-pick.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to pick a specific commit on one branch and copy the commit to another branch.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/reordering-.title: Reordering commits in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/reordering-.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to reorder commits in your branch's history.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/squashing-c.title: Squashing commits in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/squashing-c.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to squash commits in your branch's history.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/managing-ta.title: Managing tags in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/managing-ta.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to create, push, and view tags.

/en/desktop/managing-commits/checking-ou.title: Checking out a commit in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/managing-commits/checking-ou.intro: You can use GitHub Desktop to checkout a previous commit in your repository.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Working with your remote repository on GitHub or GitHub Enterprise
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: As you make changes to your project locally, you can keep them up-to-date with your remote repository. In Git, a remote is the server where your code is stored. In your case, that server is a repository on GitHub or GitHub Enterprise.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Creating an issue or pull request from GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: You can create an issue or pull request to propose and collaborate on changes to a repository.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Syncing your branch in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: As commits are pushed to your project on GitHub, you can keep your local copy of the project in sync by pulling from the remote repository.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Viewing a pull request in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: You can open a pull request branch in GitHub Desktop to view the commit history, run checks, or make changes.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Viewing and re-running checks in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: You can view the status of checks and re-run them in GitHub Desktop.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Configuring notifications in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: GitHub Desktop will keep you up-to-date with notifications about events that occur in your pull request branch.

/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.title: Changing the remote URL for a repository in GitHub Desktop
/en/desktop/working-with-your-remote-rep.intro: You can change the remote URL for a repository you're working with in GitHub Desktop. You might do this if the repository has been renamed, or the username or organization that owns the repository has changed.

/en/early-access/actions/running-additio.title: Running additional jobs in GitHub Actions

/en/early-access/actions/using-the-rest-.title: Using the REST API to download Actions network logs
/en/early-access/actions/using-the-rest-.intro: You can download your Actions network logs using the GitHub REST API.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Configuring unified contributions between GitHub Enterprise and GitHub.com
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: As a site administrator, if you''ve enabled GitHub Connect, you can allow end users to see anonymized contribution counts for their work from GitHub Enterprise on their GitHub.com contribution graph.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Including GitHub Enterprise contributions in your GitHub.com profile
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can connect your GitHub Enterprise Server instance to GitHub.com and enable end users to send contributions from your GitHub Enterprise Server instance to their GitHub.com profiles as part of a closed Early Access Program.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Managing contractors for your enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: As a site administrator, you can specify that an enterprise member is a contractor. This will limit the member's access to private and internal repositories.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Using GitHub Task Runner
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can use GitHub Task Runner as your CI/CD integrated system as part of the closed Early Access Program. GitHub Enterprise Server Task Runner allows you to automatically build, test, and deploy your code from a GitHub App, based on a configuration file in your repository.

/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/early-access.title: Identifying the token used for audit log events
/en/enterprise-cloud@latest/early-access.intro: You can identify the actions performed by a specific personal access token or OAuth token in your enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Hosting your own database for GitHub Enterprise Server with External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: Learn how to set up an external database with your GitHub Enterprise Server appliance and configure GitHub Enterprise Server Backup Utilities for External MySQL Support.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: About External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: External MySQL Support enables you to host your GitHub Enterprise Server database in a separate database host, so you can manage, monitor and service your GitHub Enterprise Server database with your preferred tooling and expertise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Enabling External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: Learn about enabling and configuring GitHub Enterprise Server with External MySQL Support.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Configuring GitHub Enterprise Server Backup Utilities for External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: To protect production data on your GitHub Enterprise Server appliance with External MySQL Support, review these recommendations and instructions to plan your backup strategy.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Initiating a failover with External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: When running GitHub Enterprise Server with External MySQL Support, review these recommendations and instructions to plan your failover strategy.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Disabling External MySQL Support
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: Site administrators can disable GitHub Enterprise Server with External MySQL Support, and revert to the bundled MySQL database instead.

/en/early-access/github/articles/managin.title: Managing your disabled GitHub Pages site
/en/early-access/github/articles/managin.intro: Private repositories on GitHub Free do not support GitHub Pages, however, a limited number of GitHub Pages sites connected to free private repositories were mistakenly left active. These sites are no longer being updated and will be unpublished by GitHub on May 10, 2019.

/en/early-access/github/articles/searchi.title: Searching and navigating code
/en/early-access/github/articles/searchi.intro: Searching and navigating code are critical parts of the development workflow, and GitHub is improving these areas. If you're part of an organization that's opted into the Code Search and Navigation Private Beta, you'll have access to powerful new search and navigation tools. For additional questions about this Private Beta, please email search-beta@github.com.

/en/early-access/github/automatically-re.title: Automatically renew the billing plan for your enterprise
/en/early-access/github/automatically-re.intro: To streamline your billing experience, you can opt into automatic renewals for your billing plan for GitHub Enterprise Server or GitHub Enterprise Cloud.

/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.title: Save time with slash commands
/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.intro: You can automate tasks in GitHub by using and creating slash commands.

/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.title: About slash commands
/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.intro: Slash commands can save you time by reducing the typing required to create complex Markdown, running GitHub Actions workflows, or automating your unique processes in GitHub.

/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.title: Create a custom slash command
/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.intro: You can automate a process in GitHub that's unique to your needs by creating a slash command.

/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.title: GitHub's form schema
/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.intro: You can use GitHub's form schema to configure forms in custom slash commands.

/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.title: Syntax for custom slash commands
/en/early-access/github/save-time-with-s.intro: You must use YAML syntax to create slash commands.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: GitHub Insights Documentation
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: Understand and improve your software delivery process through data with GitHub Insights. You can view customized reports based on data from GitHub Enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Installing and configuring GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can start using GitHub Insights by installing and configuring the application.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Installing and updating GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can install the GitHub Insights application and update the application to the latest version.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: About GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: GitHub Insights provides metrics and analytical reports to help engineering teams understand and improve their software delivery process.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: System overview for GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: GitHub Insights is a standalone application which interfaces with GitHub Enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Installing GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can install GitHub Insights and connect the standalone application to GitHub Enterprise Server.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Updating GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can update to the latest version of GitHub Insights to benefit from improvements and bug fixes.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Configuring GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can manage the connection between GitHub Insights and GitHub Enterprise and manage permissions for GitHub Insights users.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Configuring the connection between GitHub Insights and GitHub Enterprise
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can manage how GitHub Insights connects to GitHub Enterprise.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can enable a link that will allow users to navigate from GitHub Enterprise Server to GitHub Insights.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Managing data in GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: You can choose which metrics are displayed in GitHub Insights and which organizations, repositories, and people are included in those metrics. You can set targets for and add context to metrics.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: About data in GitHub Insights
/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.intro: The data included in GitHub Insights metrics is highly customizable.

/en/enterprise-server@3.11/early-access/.title: Managing available metrics and reports
